user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of calc_userdigest:
```c
_MHD_static_inline void
calc_userdigest (struct DigestAlgorithm *da,
                 const char *username, const size_t username_len,
                 const char *realm, const size_t realm_len,
                 const char *password,
                 uint8_t *ha1_bin)
{
  mhd_assert (! da->hashing);
  digest_update (da, username, username_len);
  digest_update_with_colon (da);
  digest_update (da, realm, realm_len);
  digest_update_with_colon (da);
  digest_update_str (da, password);
  digest_calc_hash (da, ha1_bin);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function calc_userdigest:
#define _MHD_static_inline staticinline__attribute__((always_inline))
...
#define mhd_assert(ignore) ((void)0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The remainder of the function body and the other symbols shown (digest_update, digest_update_with_colon, digest_update_str, digest_calc_hash, mhd_assert definition, use of uint8_t and size_t, and the function parameter list) use standard C constructs or simple macros that do not introduce compiler-specific language extensions. The only occurrences of compiler-specific extension syntax in the provided code are the macro that expands to an attribute and the attribute token itself; no other __attribute__ or other documented compiler extensions are present in the supplied code fragments. Therefore other parts do not need investigation under Rule 1.2.
